CVE-2018-0223.title: Cisco Security Manager Input Validation Flaw in DesktopServlet Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-0223.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Security Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The web-based interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Security Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy79668 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0223.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Security Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-0224.title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router StartOS CLI Input Validation Flaws Let Local Users Obtain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-0224.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.A local user with administrator privileges can supply specially crafted command line interface (CLI) command arguments to exploit an input validation flaw in the Cisco StarOS operating system and execute arbitrary commands on the target system [CVE-2018-0217, CVE-2018-0224].CVE-2018-0224 can be exploited to obtain root privileges.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvg29441 and CSCvg38807 to these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0224.extra: A local administrative user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2018-0231.title: Cisco ASA TLS Buffer Underflow Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
CVE-2018-0231.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.A remote user can send a specially crafted Transport Layer Security (TLS) message to an interface on the target device that has SSL enabled to trigger a buffer underflow in the TLS library and cause the target device to reload.Cisco Adaptive Security Virtual Appliance (ASAv) is affected.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCve18902, CSCve34335, and CSCve38446 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0231.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to reload.

CVE-2018-0234.title: Cisco Aironet Access Points PPTP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
CVE-2018-0234.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet Access Points. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.A remote user on a device that is registered to the local network can initiate a Point-to-Point Tunneling Protocol (PPTP) connection to the target device on the same local network and send a specially crafted Generic Routing Encapsulation (GRE) frame through the data plane on the target device to cause the NSS core process to crash and the device to reload.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf73890 to this vulnerability.Simon Lockhart of CableCom Networking reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0234.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to reload.

CVE-2018-0238.title: Cisco Unified Computing System Director Role-Based Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Access Virtual Machines
CVE-2018-0238.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Computing System (UCS) Director. A remote authenticated user can gain access to the target virtual machines.A remote authenticated user can login to the web interface with a valid password and a specially crafted username to exploit a role-based access control flaw and obtain potentially sensitive information for or perform permitted operations on arbitrary virtual machines in the target UCS Director end-user portal.The Rest API interface is not affected.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvh53501 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0238.extra: A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information for or perform permitted operations on arbitrary virtual machines in the target UCS Director end-user portal.

CVE-2018-0242.title: Cisco ASA Input Validation Flaw in WebVPN Management Interface Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-0242.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The WebVPN web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the WebVPN web-based management interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg33985 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0242.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the WebVPN web-based management interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-0245.title: Cisco 5500 and 8500 Series Wireless LAN Controller Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
CVE-2018-0245.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 5500 and 8500 Series Wireless LAN Controllers. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can submit a specially crafted URL to the REST API to view potentially sensitive information on the target system.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg89442 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0245.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0247.title: Cisco Aironet Access Points WebAuth Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication on the Target Network
CVE-2018-0247.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet Access Points. A remote user on the local network can bypass authentication and pass traffic on the network.A remote user on the local network can exploit a flaw in the Web Authentication (WebAuth) client to bypass authentication and pass traffic on the network.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf71789 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0247.extra: A remote user on the local network can bypass authentication and pass traffic on the network.

CVE-2018-0247.title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller WebAuth Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication on the Target Network
CVE-2018-0247.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user on the local network can bypass authentication and pass traffic on the network.A remote user on the local network can exploit a flaw in the Web Authentication (WebAuth) client to bypass authentication and pass traffic on the network.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvc79502 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0247.extra: A remote user on the local network can bypass authentication and pass traffic on the network.

CVE-2018-0251.title: Cisco ASA Input Validation Flaw in Clientless SSL VPN Portal Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-0251.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The 'Web Server Authentication Required' screen of the Clientless Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) VPN portal does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN portal and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The following models are affected:ASA 5500 SeriesASA 5500-X SeriesASA Services Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 SeriesASA Services Module for Cisco 7600 SeriesAdaptive Security Virtual Appliance (ASAv)The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvh20742 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0251.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco ASA Clientless SSL VPN portal, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-0252.title: Cisco 3500, 5500, and 8500 Series Wireless LAN Controller IPv4 Fragment Reassembly Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
CVE-2018-0252.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 3500, 5500, and 8500 Series Wireless LAN Controllers. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.A remote user can send specially crafted IPv4 fragments to the target device to trigger a fragment reassembly flaw and cause the target device to reload.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf89222 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0252.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to reload.

CVE-2018-0253.title: Cisco Secure Access Control System Input Validation Flaw in ACS Report Component Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands on the Target System
CVE-2018-0253.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Secure Access Control System. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted Action Message Format (AMF) message to the target user to trigger an input validation flaw in the processing of AMF messages in the ACS Report component and execute arbitrary commands on the target system. The commands will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve69037 to this vulnerability.Mikhail Klyuchnikov and Yury Aleynov from Positive Technologies reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0253.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

CVE-2018-0255.title: Cisco Industrial Ethernet Switch Access Control Flaw in Device Manager Web Interface Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2018-0255.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Industrial Ethernet Switch. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target device manager web interface acting as the target user.The following models are affected:2000 Series2000U Series3000 Series3010 Series4000 Series4010 Series5000 SeriesThe vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvc96405 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0255.extra: A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.

CVE-2018-0280.title: Cisco Meeting Server RTP Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Media Processes to Crash
CVE-2018-0280.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Meeting Server. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.A remote user can send a specially crafted Real-Time Transport Protocol (RTP) bitstream to trigger an input validation flaw and cause media process crashes and deny access to audio and video services.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCve79693, CSCvf91393, CSCvg64656, CSCvh30725, and CSCvi86363 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0280.extra: A remote user can cause the target media processes to crash.

CVE-2018-0287.title: Cisco WebEx Network Recording Player ARF File Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target User's System
CVE-2018-0287.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco WebEx Network Recording Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Advanced Recording Format (ARF) file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvh70213, CSCvh70222, and CSCvh70228 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0287.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-0288.title: Cisco WebEx Recording Format Player Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
CVE-2018-0288.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco WebEx Recording Format Player. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted WebEx Recording Format (WRF) file that, when opened by the target user, will access potentially sensitive information from memory on the target user's system.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvh89107, CSCvh89113, CSCvh89132, and CSCvh89142 to this vulnerability.An anonymous reporter reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0288.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from memory on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-0289.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in Log Viewer Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-0289.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The application management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in log files before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target administrator user's browser when the user views the log files. The code will originate from the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvh11308 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0289.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-0291.title: Cisco NX-OS Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code and Let Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-0291.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause the target system to reload. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol headers to trigger a buffer overflow and cause denial of service conditions or execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target device [CVE-2018-0303].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packets to the target device to trigger a buffer overflow or buffer overread and obtain potentially sensitive memory contents, cause denial of service conditions, or execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target device [CVE-2018-0304].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packets to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2018-0305].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packets to the target device to trigger a buffer overflow and cause denial of service conditions or execute arbitrary code on the target device [CVE-2018-0308].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packets to the target device to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target device [CVE-2018-0314].A remote authenticated user can send multiple specially crafted command line interface (CLI) commands or send a specially crafted SNMP poll request for a specific Object Identifier (OID) to trigger a memory free error and consume all available system memory, causing the device to reset or restart [CVE-2018-0309].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMP poll request to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2018-0299].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted packet to the management interface to trigger an input validation flaw in the NX-API and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges [CVE-2018-0313]. Systems with NX-API enabled are affected.A local user can supply specially crafted command arguments via the CLI to trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0306]. Systems with one or more feature licenses uploaded to the device are affected [even if the license is not used].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packet headers to trigger a buffer overread and obtain potentially sensitive information from memory or cause denial of service conditions on the target system [CVE-2018-0310].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packet headers to trigger a buffer overflow and cause denial of service conditions on the target system [CVE-2018-0311].A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP or HTTPS packet to the management interface to trigger a buffer overflow in the NX-API and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2018-0301]. Systems with NX-API enabled are affected.A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol message to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target device to restart [CVE-2018-0331].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted packet to the management interface to trigger an input validation flaw in the NX-API to bypass NX-OS role assignment and execute arbitrary commands with elevated privileges [CVE-2018-0330].A local user can issue specially crafted CLI commands to execute arbitrary arbitrary commands on the target device [CVE-2018-0337].A local user can exploit a flaw in the write-erase feature to configure an unauthorized account with administrator privileges that will not appear in the running configuration or the audit logs [CVE-2018-0294].A remote user that can send packets that appear to originate from a trusted Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) peer can send a specially crafted BGP update message to the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2018-0295].A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted Internet Group Management Protocol (IGMP) packets to trigger a buffer overflow in the IGMP Snooping component and cause the system to reload or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2018-0292].A remote authenticated non-administrative user can supply specially crafted CLI commands to exploit a role-based access control (RBAC) flaw and execute administrative commands to modify the configuration or boot image on the target device [CVE-2018-0293].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMP packet to the target device to trigger a protocol data unit validation flaw and cause the target device to restart [CVE-2018-0291].A local user can supply specially crafted CLI command arguments to exploit an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges [CVE-2018-0307]. On systems that support multiple virtual device contexts (VDC), this can be exploited to access arbitrary files from any VDC.
CVE-2018-0291.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to reload.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local or remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. Systems with NX-API enabled are affected.A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol message to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target device to restart [CVE-2018-0331].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted packet to the management interface to trigger an input validation flaw in the NX-API to bypass NX-OS role assignment and execute arbitrary commands with elevated privileges [CVE-2018-0330].A local user can issue specially crafted CLI commands to execute arbitrary arbitrary commands on the target device [CVE-2018-0337].A local user can exploit a flaw in the write-erase feature to configure an unauthorized account with administrator privileges that will not appear in the running configuration or the audit logs [CVE-2018-0294].A remote user that can send packets that appear to originate from a trusted Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) peer can send a specially crafted BGP update message to the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2018-0295].A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted Internet Group Management Protocol (IGMP) packets to trigger a buffer overflow in the IGMP Snooping component and cause the system to reload or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2018-0292].A remote authenticated non-administrative user can supply specially crafted CLI commands to exploit a role-based access control (RBAC) flaw and execute administrative commands to modify the configuration or boot image on the target device [CVE-2018-0293].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMP packet to the target device to trigger a protocol data unit validation flaw and cause the target device to restart [CVE-2018-0291].A local user can supply specially crafted CLI command arguments to exploit an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges [CVE-2018-0307]. On systems that support multiple virtual device contexts (VDC), this can be exploited to access arbitrary files from any VDC.

CVE-2018-0293.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause the target system to reload. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. Systems with NX-API enabled are affected.A local user can supply specially crafted command arguments via the CLI to trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0306]. Systems with NX-API enabled are affected.A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol message to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target device to restart [CVE-2018-0331].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted packet to the management interface to trigger an input validation flaw in the NX-API to bypass NX-OS role assignment and execute arbitrary commands with elevated privileges [CVE-2018-0330].A local user can issue specially crafted CLI commands to execute arbitrary arbitrary commands on the target device [CVE-2018-0337].A local user can exploit a flaw in the write-erase feature to configure an unauthorized account with administrator privileges that will not appear in the running configuration or the audit logs [CVE-2018-0294].A remote user that can send packets that appear to originate from a trusted Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) peer can send a specially crafted BGP update message to the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2018-0295].A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted Internet Group Management Protocol (IGMP) packets to trigger a buffer overflow in the IGMP Snooping component and cause the system to reload or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2018-0292].A remote authenticated non-administrative user can supply specially crafted CLI commands to exploit a role-based access control (RBAC) flaw and execute administrative commands to modify the configuration or boot image on the target device [CVE-2018-0293].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMP packet to the target device to trigger a protocol data unit validation flaw and cause the target device to restart [CVE-2018-0291].A local user can supply specially crafted CLI command arguments to exploit an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges [CVE-2018-0307]. On systems that support multiple virtual device contexts (VDC), this can be exploited to access arbitrary files from any VDC.

CVE-2018-0296.title: Cisco ASA HTTP URL Validation Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service or Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2018-0296.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA. A remote user can cause the target system to reload. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to the target device to cause the device to reload or disclose potentially sensitive information.The following models are affected:3000 Series Industrial Security Appliance (ISA)ASA 1000V Cloud Firewall ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security AppliancesASA 5500-X Series Next-Generation FirewallsASA Services Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series RoutersAdaptive Security Virtual Appliance (ASAv)Firepower 2100 Series Security ApplianceFirepower 4100 Series Security ApplianceFirepower 9300 ASA Security ModuleFTD Virtual (FTDv)The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvi16029 to this vulnerability.Michal Bentkowski from Securitum reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0296.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to reload.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol headers to trigger a buffer overflow and cause denial of service conditions or execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target device [CVE-2018-0303].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packets to the target device to trigger a buffer overflow or buffer overread and obtain potentially sensitive memory contents, cause denial of service conditions, or execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target device [CVE-2018-0304].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packets to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2018-0305].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packets to the target device to trigger a buffer overflow and cause denial of service conditions or execute arbitrary code on the target device [CVE-2018-0308].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packets to the target device to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target device [CVE-2018-0314].A remote authenticated user can send multiple specially crafted command line interface (CLI) commands or send a specially crafted SNMP poll request for a specific Object Identifier (OID) to trigger a memory free error and consume all available system memory, causing the device to reset or restart [CVE-2018-0309].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMP poll request to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2018-0299].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted packet to the management interface to trigger an input validation flaw in the NX-API and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges [CVE-2018-0313]. Systems with NX-API enabled are affected.A local user can supply specially crafted command arguments via the CLI to trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0306]. Systems with one or more feature licenses uploaded to the device are affected [even if the license is not used].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packet headers to trigger a buffer overread and obtain potentially sensitive information from memory or cause denial of service conditions on the target system [CVE-2018-0310].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packet headers to trigger a buffer overflow and cause denial of service conditions on the target system [CVE-2018-0311].A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP or HTTPS packet to the management interface to trigger a buffer overflow in the NX-API and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2018-0301]. Systems with NX-API enabled are affected.A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol message to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target device to restart [CVE-2018-0331].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted packet to the management interface to trigger an input validation flaw in the NX-API to bypass NX-OS role assignment and execute arbitrary commands with elevated privileges [CVE-2018-0330].A local user can issue specially crafted CLI commands to execute arbitrary arbitrary commands on the target device [CVE-2018-0337].A local user can exploit a flaw in the write-erase feature to configure an unauthorized account with administrator privileges that will not appear in the running configuration or the audit logs [CVE-2018-0294].A remote user that can send packets that appear to originate from a trusted Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) peer can send a specially crafted BGP update message to the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2018-0295].A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted Internet Group Management Protocol (IGMP) packets to trigger a buffer overflow in the IGMP Snooping component and cause the system to reload or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2018-0292].A remote authenticated non-administrative user can supply specially crafted CLI commands to exploit a role-based access control (RBAC) flaw and execute administrative commands to modify the configuration or boot image on the target device [CVE-2018-0293].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMP packet to the target device to trigger a protocol data unit validation flaw and cause the target device to restart [CVE-2018-0291].A local user can supply specially crafted CLI command arguments to exploit an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges [CVE-2018-0307]. On systems that support multiple virtual device contexts (VDC), this can be exploited to access arbitrary files from any VDC.
CVE-2018-0304.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to reload.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local or remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2018-0312.title: Cisco NX-OS Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code and Let Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-0312.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause the target system to reload. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol headers to trigger a buffer overflow and cause denial of service conditions or execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target device [CVE-2018-0303].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packets to the target device to trigger a buffer overflow or buffer overread and obtain potentially sensitive memory contents, cause denial of service conditions, or execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target device [CVE-2018-0304].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packets to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2018-0305].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packets to the target device to trigger a buffer overflow and cause denial of service conditions or execute arbitrary code on the target device [CVE-2018-0308].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packets to the target device to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target device [CVE-2018-0314].A remote authenticated user can send multiple specially crafted command line interface (CLI) commands or send a specially crafted SNMP poll request for a specific Object Identifier (OID) to trigger a memory free error and consume all available system memory, causing the device to reset or restart [CVE-2018-0309].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMP poll request to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2018-0299].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted packet to the management interface to trigger an input validation flaw in the NX-API and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges [CVE-2018-0313]. Systems with NX-API enabled are affected.A local user can supply specially crafted command arguments via the CLI to trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0306]. Systems with one or more feature licenses uploaded to the device are affected [even if the license is not used].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packet headers to trigger a buffer overread and obtain potentially sensitive information from memory or cause denial of service conditions on the target system [CVE-2018-0310].A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Fabric Services packet headers to trigger a buffer overflow and cause denial of service conditions on the target system [CVE-2018-0311].A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP or HTTPS packet to the management interface to trigger a buffer overflow in the NX-API and execute arbitrary code with root privileges [CVE-2018-0301]. Systems with NX-API enabled are affected.A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol message to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target device to restart [CVE-2018-0331].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted packet to the management interface to trigger an input validation flaw in the NX-API to bypass NX-OS role assignment and execute arbitrary commands with elevated privileges [CVE-2018-0330].A local user can issue specially crafted CLI commands to execute arbitrary arbitrary commands on the target device [CVE-2018-0337].A local user can exploit a flaw in the write-erase feature to configure an unauthorized account with administrator privileges that will not appear in the running configuration or the audit logs [CVE-2018-0294].A remote user that can send packets that appear to originate from a trusted Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) peer can send a specially crafted BGP update message to the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2018-0295].A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted Internet Group Management Protocol (IGMP) packets to trigger a buffer overflow in the IGMP Snooping component and cause the system to reload or execute arbitrary code [CVE-2018-0292].A remote authenticated non-administrative user can supply specially crafted CLI commands to exploit a role-based access control (RBAC) flaw and execute administrative commands to modify the configuration or boot image on the target device [CVE-2018-0293].A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMP packet to the target device to trigger a protocol data unit validation flaw and cause the target device to restart [CVE-2018-0291].A local user can supply specially crafted CLI command arguments to exploit an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges [CVE-2018-0307]. On systems that support multiple virtual device contexts (VDC), this can be exploited to access arbitrary files from any VDC.
CVE-2018-0312.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to reload.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A local or remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2018-0315.title: Cisco IOS XE AAA Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target System
CVE-2018-0315.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can attempt to authenticate and send specially crafted username data to trigger a memory error in the authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) security services and execute arbitrary code on the target system.AAA login authentication services on tty lines, including console port (CTY) lines, auxiliary (AUX) port lines, virtual terminal (VTY) lines, and asynchronous tty (TTY) lines, are affected.Login authentication on the web user interface is not affected.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvi25380 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0315.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2018-0318.title: Cisco Prime Collaboration Provisioning Password Reset Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify Arbitrary Passwords on the Target System
CVE-2018-0318.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime Collaboration Provisioning. A remote user can modify passwords on the target system.A remote user can submit a specially crafted password reset request to change the password for arbitrary users on the target system, including administrative users.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd07245 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0318.extra: A remote user can modify arbitrary passwords on the target system.

CVE-2018-0319.title: Cisco Prime Collaboration Provisioning Password Recovery Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify Arbitrary Passwords
CVE-2018-0319.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime Collaboration Provisioning. A remote user can modify passwords on the target system.A remote user can exploit a flaw in the password recovery function to change the password for arbitrary users on the target system, including administrative users.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd07253 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0319.extra: A remote user can modify arbitrary passwords on the target system.

CVE-2018-0320.title: Cisco Prime Collaboration Provisioning Input Validation Flaw in Web Framework Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
CVE-2018-0320.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime Collaboration Provisioning. A remote user can inject SQL commands.The web framework code does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd61754 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0320.extra: A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

CVE-2018-0321.title: Cisco Prime Collaboration Provisioning Open NICE Port Lets Remote Users Access the Target System
CVE-2018-0321.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime Collaboration Provisioning. A remote user can gain access to the target system.A remote user can connect to an open port in the Network Interface and Configuration Engine (NICE) service to gain access to the Java Remote Method Invocation (RMI) system and take actions on the target system and the managed devices.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd61746 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0321.extra: A remote user can take actions on the target system and the managed devices.

CVE-2018-0325.title: Cisco 7800 and 8800 Series IP Phones Input Validation Flaw in SIP SDP Parser Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2018-0325.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 7800 and 8800 Series IP Phones. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packet to trigger an input validation flaw in the SIP Session Description Protocol (SDP) parser and cause the SIP process to restart and all active phone calls on the target device to be dropped.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf40066 to this vulnerability.Mozilla reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0325.extra: A remote user can cause all active phone calls on the target device to be dropped.

CVE-2018-0327.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in Web Interface Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-0327.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Certain parameters sent via the HTTP GET and HTTP POST methods are affected.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg86743 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0327.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.

A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The web framework does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg89116 to this vulnerability.Dirk Heldner reported this vulnerability.

CVE-2018-0339.title: Cisco Identity Services Engine Input Validation Flaw in Web Management Interface Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-0339.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Identity Services Engine. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The web management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf72309 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0339.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Identity Services Engine interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-0341.title: Cisco 6800, 7800, and 8800 Series IP Phones Input Validation Flaw in Web User Interface Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Shell Commands on the Target System
CVE-2018-0341.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 6800, 7800, and 8800 Series IP Phones. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.A remote authenticated user on the web-based user interface can send specially crafted shell commands to a specific user input fields to inject and execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system.Cisco 6800, 7800, and 8800 Series IP phones running Multiplatform Firmware are affected.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvi51426 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0341.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco WebEx Player software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The web framework of the 'https://try.webex.com' page is affected.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvi71274 to this vulnerability.Daniel Diez Tainta reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0357.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco WebEx Player software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-0360.title: Clam AntiVirus File Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2018-0360.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Clam AntiVirus. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when processed by the target application, will trigger an integer overflow and cause the target application to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2018-0360].A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a PDF object length check error and cause the target application to take a long time to parse the file [CVE-2018-0361].Laurent Delosieres, Secunia Research at Flexera, and aCaB reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0360.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2018-0361.title: Clam AntiVirus File Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when processed by the target application, will trigger an integer overflow and cause the target application to enter an infinite loop [CVE-2018-0360].A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when processed by the target application, will trigger a PDF object length check error and cause the target application to take a long time to parse the file [CVE-2018-0361].Laurent Delosieres, Secunia Research at Flexera, and aCaB reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0361.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2018-0362.title: Cisco UCS E-Series Servers BIOS Access Control Bug Lets Local Users Bypass Security Restrictions
CVE-2018-0362.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco UCS E-Series Servers. A local user can bypass security restrictions.A local user can supply an empty password value to the BIOS authentication prompt to bypass BIOS authentication management functions and gain access to a restricted set of user-level BIOS commands.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvh83260 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0362.extra: A local user can gain access to a restricted set of user-level BIOS commands on the target system.

CVE-2018-0363.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence Service Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2018-0363.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence Service. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target web-based management interface acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvi55878 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0363.extra: A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.

CVE-2018-0364.title: Cisco Unified Communications Domain Manager Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
CVE-2018-0364.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Domain Manager. CVE-2018-0366.title: Cisco Web Security Appliance Input Validation Flaw in Web-Based Management Interface Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-0366.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. The code will originate from the Cisco Web Security Appliance interface and will run in the security context of that site. CVE-2018-0371.title: Cisco Meeting Server HTTP Request Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target System to Restart
CVE-2018-0371.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Meeting Server. A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to restart.A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to the Web Admin Interface on the target system to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the system to restart, terminating all ongoing calls.Cisco Meeting Server 1000 and 2000 are affected.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvi48624 to this vulnerability.Hugo Boutinon of AXA Group Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0371.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to restart, terminating all ongoing calls.

CVE-2018-0373.title: Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client for Windows Desktop Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Cause Denial of Service Conditions
CVE-2018-0373.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client for Windows Desktop. A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A local user can send a specially crafted request to the application to trigger an input validation flaw in 'vpnva-6.sys' (32-bit Windows) and 'vpnva64-6.sys' (64-bit Windows) and cause denial of service conditions.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvj47654 to this vulnerability.Gert Doering at OpenVPN and Cesar Cerrudo, Ilja van Sprundel, and Enrique Nissim from IOActive reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0373.extra: A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

CVE-2018-0378.title: Cisco NX-OS PTP Frame Flooding Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Device to Reload
CVE-2018-0378.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause the target device to reload.A remote user can send specially crafted Precision Time Protocol (PTP) data to certain Nexus 5500, 5600, and 6000 series switches to exploit a lack of protection again PTP frame flood attacks.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg21830 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0378.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

CVE-2018-0379.title: Cisco WebEx Meetings Server File ARF and WRF Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-0379.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco WebEx Meetings Server. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Advanced Recording Format (ARF) and Webex Recording Format (WRF) file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the Webex Network Recording Player and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The Cisco Webex Network Recording Player and the Cisco Webex Player are affected.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvi02621, CSCvi02965, CSCvi63329, CSCvi63333, CSCvi63335, CSCvi63374, CSCvi63376, CSCvi63377, CSCvi63391, CSCvi63392, CSCvi63396, CSCvi63495, CSCvi63497, CSCvi63498, CSCvi82684, CSCvi82700, CSCvi82705, CSCvi82725, CSCvi82737, CSCvi82742, CSCvi82760, CSCvi82771, CSCvj51284, and CSCvj51294 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0379.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-0395.title: Cisco NX-OS LLDP TLV Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
CVE-2018-0395.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.A remote user on the adjacent network can send Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) data with specially crafted type, length, and value fields (TLV) to an interface on the target device to cause the device to reload.The following models are affected:Nexus 2000 SeriesNexus 3000 SeriesNexus 3500 PlatformNexus 5500 PlatformNexus 5600 PlatformNexus 6000 PlatformNexus 7000 SeriesNexus 7700 SeriesNexus 9000 Series Fabric Switches in Application Centric Infrastructure (ACI) modeUnified Computing System (UCS) 6100 Series Fabric InterconnectsUCS 6200 Series Fabric InterconnectsUCS 6300 Series Fabric InterconnectsThe vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuc98542, CSCvf23367, CSCvj94174, and CSCvj96148 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0395.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

CVE-2018-0400.title: Cisco Unified Contact Center Express Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery and Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Obtain Passwords
CVE-2018-0400.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Unified Contact Center Express. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can obtain passwords on the target system. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target web-based management interface acting as the target user [CVE-2018-0402].The web-based management interface prefills the password field with a previously saved password from an internal database [CVE-2018-0403. A remote user can view the HTML source to retrieve a cleartext password on the target system.The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2018-0400, CVE-2018-0401]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Unified Contact Center Express software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvg70904, CSCvg70921, CSCvg70967, and CSCvg71040 to these vulnerabilities.Filip Waeytens from NCI Agency Cyber Security reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0400.extra: A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.A remote user can obtain passwords on the target system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Unified Contact Center Express software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-0409.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco TelePresence Video Communication Server (VCS). A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 7400 to trigger a buffer over-read and cause the XCP Router service to crash and restart.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvi55947 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0409.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2018-0409.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager IM & Presence Service. CVE-2018-0416.title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
CVE-2018-0416.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted request to view potentially sensitive information on the target system.The following devices may be affected:Physical wireless LAN controllers Virtual wireless LAN controllers802.11ac Wave2 access points that are running in Mobility Express mode and configured as a wireless LAN controllerThe vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvj95336 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0416.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0418.title: Cisco ASR 9000 Series Router LPTS Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2018-0418.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 9000 Series Router. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted Precision Time Protocol (PTP) data to the target device to trigger an input validation flaw in the Local Packet Transport Services (LPTS) implementation and cause services on the target device to become unresponsive.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvj22858 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0418.extra: A remote user can cause the services on the target device to become unresponsive.

CVE-2018-0419.title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Executable File Detection Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Filtering on the Target System
CVE-2018-0419.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance (ESA). A remote user can bypass security filtering on the target system.The system does not properly detect content within executable (EXE) files. A remote user can send a specially crafted EXE file to bypass security detection and filtering on the target system.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvh03786 to this vulnerability.Liam Romanis of InteliSecure EMEA reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0419.extra: A remote user can bypass security filtering on the target system.

CVE-2018-0420.title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2018-0420.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data in an HTTP request for filenames and pathnames to view certain system files that may contain potentially sensitive information on the target system.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf66723 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0420.extra: A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0423.title: Cisco Small Business RV Series Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-0423.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV110W/RV130W/RV215W Series. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the Guest user feature of the web-based management interface and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvj23206, CSCvj42727, and CSCvj42729 to this vulnerability.Qingtang Zheng of 360 ESG CodeSafe Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0423.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2018-0424.title: Cisco Small Business RV Series Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands on the Target System
CVE-2018-0424.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV110W/RV130W/RV215W Series. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted request to the target web-based management interface to trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands on the target system. The commands will run with root user privileges.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvj23214, CSCvj42736, and CSCvj42741 to this vulnerability.Qingtang Zheng of 360 ESG CodeSafe Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0424.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

CVE-2018-0425.title: Cisco Small Business RV Series Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
CVE-2018-0425.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV110W/RV130W/RV215W Series. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted request to the target web-based management interface to view potentially sensitive configuration information, including user authentication credentials, on the target system.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvj23227, CSCvj42744, and CSCvj42746 to this vulnerability.Qingtang Zheng of 360 ESG CodeSafe Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0425.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including authentication credentials, on the target system.

CVE-2018-0426.title: Cisco Small Business RV Series Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Files on the Target System
CVE-2018-0426.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV110W/RV130W/RV215W Series. A remote user can obtain files on the target system.A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted request containing directory traversal character sequences to the target web-based management interface to trigger an input validation flaw and view arbitrary files on the target system.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvj23233, CSCvj42750, and CSCvj42752 to this vulnerability.Qingtang Zheng of 360 ESG CodeSafe Team reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0426.extra: A remote user can obtain files on the target system.

CVE-2018-0428.title: Cisco Web Security Appliance Access Control Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
CVE-2018-0428.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Web Security Appliance. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can exploit an access control flaw in the account management subsystem to gain information that can be used to escape the command line interface (CLI) subshell and execute commands on the underlying operating system with root privileges.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvj93548 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0428.extra: A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.

CVE-2018-0439.extra: A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.

CVE-2018-0440.title: Cisco Data Center Network Manager Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands on the Target System
CVE-2018-0440.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Data Center Network Manager. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.A remote authenticated application administrative user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system of the target system. The commands will run with root privileges.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvi47733 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0440.extra: A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

CVE-2018-0443.title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller CAPWAP Discovery Request Processing Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Disconnect and Reconnect
CVE-2018-0443.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause the target service to disconnect and reconnect.A remote user can send specially crafted Control and Provisioning of Wireless Access Points (CAPWAP) discovery request packets to cause the target service to disconnect and reconnect.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf66696 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0443.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to disconnect and reconnect.

CVE-2018-0447.title: Cisco Email Security Appliance Sender Policy Framework Message Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-0447.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Email Security Appliance. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted Sender Policy Framework (SPF) message to the target system to cause the system to bypass certain content filters.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvj55728 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0447.extra: A remote user can bypass security filters on the target system.

CVE-2018-0456.title: Cisco NX-OS SNMP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target Device to Crash
CVE-2018-0456.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to crash.A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) input to the target device to cause the device to reload.The following models are affected:Nexus 3000 Series - 7.0(3)I7(3)Nexus 3600 Platform - 7.0(3)F3(4)Nexus 9000 Series Switches in standalone NX-OS modeNexus 9500 R-Series Line Cards and Fabric ModulesThe vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvj70029 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0456.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to crash.

CVE-2018-0458.title: Cisco Prime Collaboration Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-0458.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Prime Collaboration. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Prime Collaboration software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg15441 to this vulnerability.Adam Willard reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0458.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Prime Collaboration software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-0464.title: Cisco Data Center Network Manager Lets Remote Authenticated Users Traverse the Directory to Create or View Files on the Target System
CVE-2018-0464.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Data Center Network Manager. A remote authenticated user can create or view files on the target system.The management interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted request to create or view files on target system that are located outside of the document directory.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvj86072 to this vulnerability.Tenable, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0464.extra: A remote authenticated user can create or view files on the target system.

CVE-2018-0467.title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Cause the Target Device to Hang or Reload and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-0467.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can cause the target service to hang or reload. A local user can gain elevated privileges.A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP) packets to the target adjacent device to trigger a memory leak, eventually causing a memory allocation error and causing the target device to crash [CVE-2018-0471].Cisco IOS XE versions 16.6.1 and 16.6.2 are affected.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf50648 to this vulnerability.A remote user can send a specially crafted Cluster Management Protocol (CMP) message to cause the target device to crash and reload or hang [CVE-2018-0475]. A manual reboot may be required to return the system to normal operations.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg48576 to this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a race condition between a VLAN and port when entering an 'errdisabled' state, causing the target IOS XE device to crash [CVE-2018-0480].Cisco Catalyst 3650, 3850, and 4500E series switches are affected when the errdisable feature is enabled for a feature at both the VLAN and port level.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvh13611 to this vulnerability.A local user with privilege level 15 (EXEC mode) can send specially crafted command line interface commands to trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary Linux operating system commands on the target IOS XE system with root privileges [CVE-2018-0477, CVE-2018-0481].The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvh02919 and CSCvh54202 to these vulnerabilities.A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 hop-by-hop options to or through the target device to cause the device to reload [CVE-2018-0467].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz28570 to this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted Precision Time Protocol (PTP) data to or through the target IOS device to trigger a synchronization error and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2018-0473].The Cisco 2500 Series Connected Grid Switches, Cisco Connected Grid Ethernet Switch Module Interface Card, and the Industrial Ethernet 2000, 2000U, 3000, 2010, 4000, 4010, and 5000 Series Switches are affected.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvf94015 and CSCvh77659 to this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP packets to the target device to trigger a buffer overflow and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2018-0470].Systems running the HTTP Server feature are affected.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb22618 to this vulnerability.A remote user can with access to the management interface can send specially crafted HTTP requests to the target web user interface to trigger a double-free memory error and cause the target device to crash [CVE-2018-0469]. IOS XE versions 16.2.2 and later require authentication to exploit. Cisco Catalyst 3650 and 3850 series devices are affected if the HTTP Server feature is enabled.The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCva31961 to this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted IPsec Authentication Header (AH) or Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) packets to cause the target system to crash [CVE-2018-0472].The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvf73114, CSCvg37952, CSCvh04189, CSCvh04591, and CSCvi30496 to this vulnerability.A remote user can send specially crafted Open Shortest Path First version 3 (OSPFv3) Link-State Advertisements (LSA) data to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2018-0466].The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy82806 to this vulnerability.Dmitry Kuznetsov of Digital Security reported one vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0467.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to crash or reload.A local user can obtain root privileges on the target device.

CVE-2018-0472.title: Cisco ASA 5500-X Series IPsec Driver Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
CVE-2018-0472.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASA 5500-X Series. A remote user can cause the target system to crash.A remote user can send specially crafted IPsec Authentication Header (AH) or Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) packets to cause the target system to crash.The ASA 5506-X, 5508-X, and 5516-X series appliances are affected.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvf73114, CSCvg37952, CSCvh04189, CSCvh04591, and CSCvi30496 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0472.extra: A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
