CVE-2018-0485.title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Data Processing Error on Integrated Services Routers Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2018-0485.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target SM-1T3/E3 module console to cause the module (or the device the module is running on) to cause denial of service conditions.The Cisco Second Generation Integrated Services Routers (ISR G2) and the Cisco 4451-X Integrated Services Router (ISR4451-X) are affected.The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuz92665, CSCva23932, and CSCvi95007 to this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0485.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2018-0494.title: wget Input Validation Flaw in SetCookie Processing Lets Remote Users Inject Arbitrary Cookies on the Target System
CVE-2018-0494.body: A vulnerability was reported in wget. A remote user can set and modify cookies on the target system.The software does not properly process Set-Cookie responses. A remote server can return specially crafted data to inject arbitrary cookies into the cookie jar file on the target system.The vendor was notified on April 26, 2018.The original advisory including demonstration exploit steps is available at:https://sintonen.fi/advisories/gnu-wget-cookie-injection.txtHarry Sintonen of F-Secure Corporation reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0494.extra: A remote user can set and modify cookies on the target system.

CVE-2018-0500.title: curl Buffer Overflow in Curl_smtp_escape_eob() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target System
CVE-2018-0500.body: A vulnerability was reported in curl. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.When a system invokes curl to send data via SMTP and uses a reduced read buffer, a buffer overflow may occur. A remote user that can cause the target system to trigger these conditions may be able to cause denial of service conditions or execute arbitrary code on the target system.Peter Wu reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0500.extra: A remote user may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system in certain cases.

CVE-2018-0503.title: MediaWiki Multiple Flaws Let Remote Authenticated Users Bypass Security Restrictions and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2018-0503.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in MediaWiki. A remote authenticated user can bypass security restrictions. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.The '$wgRateLimits' rate limiter entry for 'user' overrides the setting for 'newbie' users [CVE-2018-0503]. A remote authenticated user can bypass intended limits.When a log event is partially hidden, a remote authenticated user can access potentially sensitive information via the 'Special:Redirect/logid' function [CVE-2018-0504].A remote authenticated user with permissions to change user rights can bypass certain security controls on the target system [CVE-2018-0505].The version 1.31 tar archive is missing '.htaccess' files [CVE-2018-13258].Rxy and JJMC89 reported some of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0503.extra: A remote authenticated user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0505.title: MediaWiki Multiple Flaws Let Remote Authenticated Users Bypass Security Restrictions and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2018-0505.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in MediaWiki. A remote authenticated user can bypass security restrictions. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.The '$wgRateLimits' rate limiter entry for 'user' overrides the setting for 'newbie' users [CVE-2018-0503]. A remote authenticated user can bypass intended limits.When a log event is partially hidden, a remote authenticated user can access potentially sensitive information via the 'Special:Redirect/logid' function [CVE-2018-0504].A remote authenticated user with permissions to change user rights can bypass certain security controls on the target system [CVE-2018-0505].The version 1.31 tar archive is missing '.htaccess' files [CVE-2018-13258].Rxy and JJMC89 reported some of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0505.extra: A remote authenticated user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0711.title: QNAP Storage Devices Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-0711.body: A vulnerability was reported in QNAP Storage Devices. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the QNAP Storage Devices interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Xie Wei and Li Yanlong reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0711.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the QNAP Storage Devices interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-0748.title: Windows Kernel API Permission Errors Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-0748.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows Kernel API. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a permissions error in the Windows Kernel API and impersonate processes, inject cross-process communication, or interrupt system functionality [CVE-2018-0748, CVE-2018-0751, CVE-2018-0752].James Forshaw of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0748.extra: A local user can impersonate processes, inject cross-process communication, or interrupt system functionality.

CVE-2018-0751.title: Windows Kernel API Permission Errors Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-0751.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows Kernel API. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a permissions error in the Windows Kernel API and impersonate processes, inject cross-process communication, or interrupt system functionality [CVE-2018-0748, CVE-2018-0751, CVE-2018-0752].James Forshaw of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0751.extra: A local user can impersonate processes, inject cross-process communication, or interrupt system functionality.

CVE-2018-0755.title: Microsoft Windows Embedded OpenType Font Engine Parsing Flaws Let Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
CVE-2018-0755.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Windows Embedded OpenType Font Engine. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A local user can open a document containing specially crafted fonts to trigger a parsing error in the Microsoft Windows Embedded OpenType (EOT) font engine and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0755, CVE-2018-0855]. Versions 7 SP1 and 2008 R2 SP1 are affected.A local user can open a document containing specially crafted fonts to trigger a parsing error in the Microsoft Windows Embedded OpenType (EOT) font engine and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0760, CVE-2018-0761].kdot (via Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative) and Hossein Lotfi, Secunia Research at Flexera Software, reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0755.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0758.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Bypass Cross-Domain Security Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-0758.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass cross-domain security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0758, CVE-2018-0768, CVE-2018-0769, CVE-2018-0770, CVE-2018-0773, CVE-2018-0774, CVE-2018-0775, CVE-2018-0776, CVE-2018-0777, CVE-2018-0778, CVE-2018-0781].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and access potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0767, CVE-2018-0780, CVE-2018-0800].A remote user can bypass cross-domain security policies on the target system to access information from another domain [CVE-2018-0803].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Microsoft Edge PDF Reader and access potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0766].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0762, CVE-2018-0772]. This can also be exploited via an ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the browser rendering engine.Wei of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Joshua Graham with TSS, Johnathan Norman of Windows Devices Group - Operating System Security Team, 010 (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Tao Yan (@Ga1ois) of Palo Alto Networks, and Anonymous (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0758.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass cross-domain security controls on the target system to access information from another domain.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0760.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

A remote user can bypass cross-domain security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0758, CVE-2018-0768, CVE-2018-0769, CVE-2018-0770, CVE-2018-0773, CVE-2018-0774, CVE-2018-0775, CVE-2018-0776, CVE-2018-0777, CVE-2018-0778, CVE-2018-0781].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and access potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0767, CVE-2018-0780, CVE-2018-0800].A remote user can bypass cross-domain security policies on the target system to access information from another domain [CVE-2018-0803].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Microsoft Edge PDF Reader and access potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0766].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0762, CVE-2018-0772]. CVE-2018-0762.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Object Memory Handling Flaws Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-0762.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0762, CVE-2018-0772]. This can also be exploited via an ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the browser rendering engine.Tao Yan (@Ga1ois) of Palo Alto Networks and Anonymous (via Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0762.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0834, CVE-2018-0835, CVE-2018-0836, CVE-2018-0837, CVE-2018-0838, CVE-2018-0840, CVE-2018-0856, CVE-2018-0857, CVE-2018-0859, CVE-2018-0860, CVE-2018-0861, CVE-2018-0866].The ChakraCore scripting engine is also affected [CVE-2018-0858].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when viewed by the target user, will bypass Same-Origin Policy (SOP) restrictions and read potentially sensitive information from the target user's browser [CVE-2018-0771].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0763, CVE-2018-0839].Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Michael Holman of Microsoft Chakra Core Team, Dmitri Kaslov of Telspace Systems (via Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative), Johnathan Norman of Windows Devices Group - Operating System Security Team, Lucas Pinheiro of Windows & Devices Group - Operating System Security Team, Jeonghoon Shin@Theori, Ivan Fratric of Google Project Zero, yeivin nadav (akayn), Marcin Towalski (@mtowalski1), and @j00sean (Thanks to Domato: https://github.com/google/domato) (via Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0763.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0785.title: ASP.NET Input Validation Flaws Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery and Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-0785.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in ASP.NET. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target interface acting as the target user [CVE-2018-0785]. Web applications created using vulnerable project templates are affected. This can be exploited to change the recovery codes associated with the target user's account.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2018-0784]. The code will originate from the site running the ASP.NET software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2018-0785.extra: A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the ASP.NET software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-0792.title: Microsoft Office Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Spoof Email Addresses and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-0792.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can spoof email addresses.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user via Microsoft Office or Microsoft WordPad, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-0804, CVE-2018-0805, CVE-2018-0806, CVE-2018-0807, CVE-2018-0812, CVE-2018-0845, CVE-2018-0848, CVE-2018-0849, CVE-2018-0862]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Versions 2007 SP3, 2010 SP2, 2013 SP1, 2013 RT SP1, 2016, 2016 Click-to-Run (C2R), and Office Compatibility Pack SP3 are affected.A remote user can send a specially crafted email attachment to exploit a flaw in Microsoft Outlook for Mac in the encoding and display of email addresses to spoof email addresses [CVE-2018-0819].A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user via Microsoft Office, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-0795]. Versions 2007 SP3, 2010 SP2, 2013 SP1, 2013 RT SP1, 2016, 2016 Click-to-Run (C2R), and Office Compatibility Pack SP3 are affected.A remote user can create a specially crafted RTF file that, when loaded by the target user via Microsoft Office, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-0797]. Versions 2007 SP3, 2010 SP2, 2013 SP1, 2013 RT SP1, 2016, 2016 Click-to-Run (C2R), Office Compatibility Pack SP3, Web Apps 2010 SP2, Web Apps Server 2013 SP1, 2016 for Mac, Online Server 2016, and Word Viewer are affected.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user via Microsoft Office or Microsoft WordPad, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-0801, CVE-2018-0802]. Versions 2007 SP3, 2010 SP2, 2013 SP1, 2013 RT SP1, 2016, 2016 Click-to-Run (C2R), Office Compatibility Pack SP3, Web Apps 2010 SP2, Web Apps Server 2013 SP1, 2016 for Mac, Online Server 2016, and Word Viewer are affected.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user via Microsoft Office or Microsoft WordPad, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-0798].
CVE-2018-0792.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can spoof a email addresses.

CVE-2018-0799.title: Microsoft SharePoint Input Validation Flaw in Access Database Image Design View Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-0799.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft SharePoint. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input in image fields edited within Design view. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Microsoft SharePoint interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2018-0799.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Microsoft SharePoint interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-0800.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Bypass Cross-Domain Security Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-0800.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass cross-domain security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0758, CVE-2018-0768, CVE-2018-0769, CVE-2018-0770, CVE-2018-0773, CVE-2018-0774, CVE-2018-0775, CVE-2018-0776, CVE-2018-0777, CVE-2018-0778, CVE-2018-0781].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and access potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0767, CVE-2018-0780, CVE-2018-0800].A remote user can bypass cross-domain security policies on the target system to access information from another domain [CVE-2018-0803].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Microsoft Edge PDF Reader and access potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0766].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0762, CVE-2018-0772]. This can also be exploited via an ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the browser rendering engine.Wei of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Joshua Graham with TSS, Johnathan Norman of Windows Devices Group - Operating System Security Team, 010 (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Tao Yan (@Ga1ois) of Palo Alto Networks, and Anonymous (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0800.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass cross-domain security controls on the target system to access information from another domain.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0802.title: Microsoft Office Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Spoof Email Addresses and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-0802.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can spoof email addresses.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user via Microsoft Office or Microsoft WordPad, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-0804, CVE-2018-0805, CVE-2018-0806, CVE-2018-0807, CVE-2018-0812, CVE-2018-0845, CVE-2018-0848, CVE-2018-0849, CVE-2018-0862]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user. Versions 2007 SP3, 2010 SP2, 2013 SP1, 2013 RT SP1, 2016, 2016 Click-to-Run (C2R), and Office Compatibility Pack SP3 are affected.A remote user can send a specially crafted email attachment to exploit a flaw in Microsoft Outlook for Mac in the encoding and display of email addresses to spoof email addresses [CVE-2018-0819].A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user via Microsoft Office, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-0795]. Versions 2007 SP3, 2010 SP2, 2013 SP1, 2013 RT SP1, 2016, 2016 Click-to-Run (C2R), and Office Compatibility Pack SP3 are affected.A remote user can create a specially crafted RTF file that, when loaded by the target user via Microsoft Office, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-0797]. Versions 2007 SP3, 2010 SP2, 2013 SP1, 2013 RT SP1, 2016, 2016 Click-to-Run (C2R), Office Compatibility Pack SP3, Web Apps 2010 SP2, Web Apps Server 2013 SP1, 2016 for Mac, Online Server 2016, and Word Viewer are affected.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user via Microsoft Office or Microsoft WordPad, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-0801, CVE-2018-0802]. Versions 2007 SP3, 2010 SP2, 2013 SP1, 2013 RT SP1, 2016, 2016 Click-to-Run (C2R), Office Compatibility Pack SP3, Web Apps 2010 SP2, Web Apps Server 2013 SP1, 2016 for Mac, Online Server 2016, and Word Viewer are affected.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user via Microsoft Office or Microsoft WordPad, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-0798].
CVE-2018-0802.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can spoof a email addresses.

CVE-2018-0821.title: Windows AppContainer, Named Pipe File System, and Storage Services Flaws Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-0821.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows AppContainer, Named Pipe File System, and Storage Services. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a constrained impersonation error in AppContainer and run processes with elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0821].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object handling error in Named Pipe File System and run processes with elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0823].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling error in Storage Services and run processes with elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0826].James Forshaw of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0821.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2018-0829.title: Windows Kernel Multiple Flaws Let Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information and Gain Elevated Privileges on the Target System
CVE-2018-0829.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a memory address initialization error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0810]. Versions 7 SP1, 2008 R2, 2008 R2 SP1, 2008 SP2, and 2012 are affected.A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit a flaw in Windows Scripting Host to bypass the a Device Guard User Mode Code Integrity (UMCI) policy on the target system [CVE-2018-0827]. Versions 7 SP1, 2008 SP2, 2012, 10 Version 1703, and 10 Version 1709 are affected.The system may not properly secure the MultiPoint management account password. A local user can run a specially crafted application to run arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0828]. Versions 7 SP1, 2008 SP2, 2012, 2016, 10 Version 1703, and 10 Version 1709 are affected.A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a memory address initialization error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0843].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0757, CVE-2018-0829, CVE-2018-0830].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling error and obtain elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0742, CVE-2018-0756, CVE-2018-0831, A local user can run a specially crafted application to obtain potentially sensitive information and bypass Kernel Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection on the target system [CVE-2018-0832].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code with kernel level privileges [CVE-2018-0809].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges [CVE-2018-0820].Mateusz Jurczyk of Google Project Zero, Matt Nelson (@enigma0x3) of SpecterOps, fanxiaocao and pjf of IceSword Lab, Qihoo 360, Alex Ionescu, CrowdStrike Inc., WenQunWang of Tencent's Xuanwu LAB, ZhangSen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, and John Heasman of DocuSign reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0829.extra: A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2018-0833.title: Windows Server Message Block Request Processing Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target System to Crash
CVE-2018-0833.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Server Message Block. A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to crash.A remote authenticated Server Message Block (SMB) server can return specially crafted SMB data to the connected client to cause the target client system to stop responding.A manual restart is required to return the system to normal operation.Nabeel Ahmed and Eric Schayes from Dimension Data (via Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0833.extra: A remote authenticated user can cause the connected target client system to stop responding.A manual restart is required to return the system to normal operation.

CVE-2018-0834.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-0834.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0834, CVE-2018-0835, CVE-2018-0836, CVE-2018-0837, CVE-2018-0838, CVE-2018-0840, CVE-2018-0856, CVE-2018-0857, CVE-2018-0859, CVE-2018-0860, CVE-2018-0861, CVE-2018-0866].The ChakraCore scripting engine is also affected [CVE-2018-0858].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when viewed by the target user, will bypass Same-Origin Policy (SOP) restrictions and read potentially sensitive information from the target user's browser [CVE-2018-0771].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0763, CVE-2018-0839].Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Michael Holman of Microsoft Chakra Core Team, Dmitri Kaslov of Telspace Systems (via Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative), Johnathan Norman of Windows Devices Group - Operating System Security Team, Lucas Pinheiro of Windows & Devices Group - Operating System Security Team, Jeonghoon Shin@Theori, Ivan Fratric of Google Project Zero, yeivin nadav (akayn), Marcin Towalski (@mtowalski1), and @j00sean (Thanks to Domato: https://github.com/google/domato) (via Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0834.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0840.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0840.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Object Memory Handling Bugs Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-0840.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0840, CVE-2018-0866].These vulnerabilities can also be exploited via an ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" embedded within an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the rendering engine.Lokihardt of Google Project Zero and Ivan Fratric of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0840.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-0843.title: Windows Kernel Multiple Flaws Let Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information and Gain Elevated Privileges on the Target System
CVE-2018-0843.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a memory address initialization error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0810]. Versions 7 SP1, 2008 R2, 2008 R2 SP1, 2008 SP2, and 2012 are affected.A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit a flaw in Windows Scripting Host to bypass the a Device Guard User Mode Code Integrity (UMCI) policy on the target system [CVE-2018-0827]. Versions 7 SP1, 2008 SP2, 2012, 10 Version 1703, and 10 Version 1709 are affected.The system may not properly secure the MultiPoint management account password. A local user can run a specially crafted application to run arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0828]. Versions 7 SP1, 2008 SP2, 2012, 2016, 10 Version 1703, and 10 Version 1709 are affected.A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a memory address initialization error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0843].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0757, CVE-2018-0829, CVE-2018-0830].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling error and obtain elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0742, CVE-2018-0756, CVE-2018-0831, A local user can run a specially crafted application to obtain potentially sensitive information and bypass Kernel Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protection on the target system [CVE-2018-0832].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code with kernel level privileges [CVE-2018-0809].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges [CVE-2018-0820].Mateusz Jurczyk of Google Project Zero, Matt Nelson (@enigma0x3) of SpecterOps, fanxiaocao and pjf of IceSword Lab, Qihoo 360, Alex Ionescu, CrowdStrike Inc., WenQunWang of Tencent's Xuanwu LAB, ZhangSen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, and John Heasman of DocuSign reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0843.extra: A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2018-0847.title: Windows Scripting Engine Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Memory Contents on the Target System
CVE-2018-0847.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Scripting Engine. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted VBScript that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and disclose potentially sensitive memory contents on the target system.
CVE-2018-0847.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive memory contents on the target system.

CVE-2018-0851.title: Microsoft Office Memory Access Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2018-0851.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-0851]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.The Preview Pane is not an attack vector.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an out-of-bound memory access error and access potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0853].Ben Faull of Microsoft Office Security and Dmitri Kaslov of Telspace Systems reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0851.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code or obtain potentially sensitive information on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-0852.title: Microsoft Outlook File Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-0852.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Outlook. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user via Microsoft Outlook, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Nicolas Joly of Microsoft Corporation reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0852.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-0855.title: Microsoft Windows Embedded OpenType Font Engine Parsing Flaws Let Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
CVE-2018-0855.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Windows Embedded OpenType Font Engine. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A local user can open a document containing specially crafted fonts to trigger a parsing error in the Microsoft Windows Embedded OpenType (EOT) font engine and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0755, CVE-2018-0855]. Versions 7 SP1 and 2008 R2 SP1 are affected.A local user can open a document containing specially crafted fonts to trigger a parsing error in the Microsoft Windows Embedded OpenType (EOT) font engine and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0760, CVE-2018-0761].kdot (via Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative) and Hossein Lotfi, Secunia Research at Flexera Software, reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0855.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0864.title: Microsoft SharePoint Input Validation Flaws Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-0864.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft SharePoint. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Ashar Javed of Hyundai AutoEver Europe GmbH reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0864.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-0868.title: Windows Component Flaws Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-0868.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in several Windows components. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.The Windows Installer does not properly sanitize user-supplied input. A local user can exploit this library loading error to execute arbitrary code with system privileges [CVE-2018-0868].The Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) kernel-mode driver (cng.sys) does not properly validate and enforce impersonation levels [CVE-2018-0902]. A local user can create a specially crafted application that, when run by the target user, will gain access to information beyond the access level of the local user.A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling error in the Windows kernel-mode driver and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel level privileges [CVE-2018-0977].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling error in Storage Services and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel level privileges [CVE-2018-0983].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a file path management error in the Desktop Bridge VFS and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel level privileges [CVE-2018-0877].A local user can run a specially crafted application to an error in managing the virtual registry in the Desktop Bridge VFS and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges [CVE-2018-0880].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling error in the the Microsoft Video Control and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with system level privileges [CVE-2018-0881].A local user can run a specially crafted application to an error in managing the virtual registry in Desktop Bridge and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel-level privileges [CVE-2018-0882].Daniel Docherty of MWR Labs, @SandboxEscaper, Matt Nelson (@enigma0x3) of SpecterOps, James Forshaw of Google Project Zero, Anonymous (via Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative), and Nicolas Joly of MSRCE UK reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0868.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

This can also be exploited via an embedded ActiveX control marked 'safe for initialization' in an application or Microsoft Office document hosting the Internet Explorer (IE) rendering engine.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0991, CVE-2018-0997, CVE-2018-0870, CVE-2018-1018, CVE-2018-1020].Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Anonymous (via Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative), Wei of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Genwei Jiang of FireEye, Inc, and hungtt28 of Viettel Cyber Security reported these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2018-0871.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-0871.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain files on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8227, CVE-2018-8229].The system does not properly mark files. A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will access file contents on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0871].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8110, CVE-2018-8111, CVE-2018-8236].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8234].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass Same-Origin Policy (SOP) restrictions [CVE-2018-8235].Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Ziyahan Albeniz of Netsparker, Marcin Towalski (@mtowalski1), Yunhai Zhang of NSFOCUS, Zhenhuan Li(@zenhumany) of Tencent Zhanlu Lab, Jake Archibald - Google - https://jakearchibald.com, Chakra working with Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative, and Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team reported these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2018-0885.title: Microsoft Hyper-V Flaws Let Local Users on the Guest System Obtain Memory Contents on the Host System and Deny Service on the Host System
CVE-2018-0885.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Hyper-V. A local user on the guest system can cause denial of service conditions on the host system. A local user on the guest system can obtain potentially sensitive information from host system memory.The Hyper-V Network Switch does not properly validate input from a privileged user on a guest operating system [CVE-2018-0885]. A local privileged user on the guest system can run a specially crafted application to cause the host system to crash. Windows 7 SP1 is not affected.A local user on the guest system can run a specially crafted application to obtain potentially sensitive information from host system memory [CVE-2018-0888].Jordan Rabet, Microsoft Offensive Security Research Team and Joe Bialek, MSRC Vulnerabilities and Mitigations Team reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0885.extra: A local privileged user on the guest system can cause the host system to crash.A local user on the guest system can obtain potentially sensitive information from system memory on the host system.

CVE-2018-0886.title: Microsoft Credential Security Support Provider Protocol Request Validation Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Code on the Target System
CVE-2018-0886.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Microsoft Credential Security Support Provider (CredSSP) protocol implementation. A remote user can execute code on the target system.The CredSSP protocol does not properly validate requests during authentication. A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can relay user credentials and use them to execute code on the target system.Applications that depend on CredSSP for authentication may be affected.Eyal Karni, Yaron Zinar, Roman Blachman @ Preempt, Research Labs reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0886.extra: A remote user can execute code on the target system.

CVE-2018-0889.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Bypass Sandbox Restrictions, and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2018-0889.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0889, CVE-2018-0935]. This can also be exploited via an embedded ActiveX control marked 'safe for initialization' in an application or Office document that hosts the rendering engine.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the scripting engine and access potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0929].A remote user that can exploit a separate vulnerability can trigger a flaw in the handling of zone and integrity settings to escape the sandbox protections and gain elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0942].Anonymous (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), SkyLined (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), and Ivan Fratric of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0889.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0894.title: Windows Kernel Memory Object Initialization Errors Let Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
CVE-2018-0894.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows Kernel. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit a memory object initialization error and obtain potentially sensitive information that can be used to bypass Kernel Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) protections [CVE-2018-0811, CVE-2018-0894, CVE-2018-0895, CVE-2018-0896, CVE-2018-0897, CVE-2018-0898, CVE-2018-0899, CVE-2018-0900, CVE-2018-0901, CVE-2018-0904].A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit a memory object initialization error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-0813, CVE-2018-0814, CVE-2018-0926].Mateusz Jurczyk of Google Project Zero and fanxiaocao and pjf of IceSword Lab, Qihoo 360 reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0894.extra: A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0909.title: Microsoft SharePoint Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-0909.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft SharePoint. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The system does not properly verify tenant permissions. A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted request to gain the privileges of the target tenant [CVE-2018-0947]. This can be exploited to read, edit, or delete content and change permissions.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2018-0909, CVE-2018-0910, CVE-2018-0911, CVE-2018-0912, CVE-2018-0913, CVE-2018-0914, CVE-2018-0915, CVE-2018-0916, CVE-2018-0917, CVE-2018-0921, CVE-2018-0923, CVE-2018-0944]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Ashar Javed of Hyundai AutoEver Europe GmbH and Ivan Vagunin reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0909.extra: A remote authenticated user can gain tenant privileges on the target system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-0912.title: Microsoft SharePoint Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-0912.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft SharePoint. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The system does not properly verify tenant permissions. A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted request to gain the privileges of the target tenant [CVE-2018-0947]. This can be exploited to read, edit, or delete content and change permissions.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2018-0909, CVE-2018-0910, CVE-2018-0911, CVE-2018-0912, CVE-2018-0913, CVE-2018-0914, CVE-2018-0915, CVE-2018-0916, CVE-2018-0917, CVE-2018-0921, CVE-2018-0923, CVE-2018-0944]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Ashar Javed of Hyundai AutoEver Europe GmbH and Ivan Vagunin reported these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2018-0919.title: Microsoft Office Out-of-Bounds Memory Read Error Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
CVE-2018-0919.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when opened by the target user with Microsoft Office, will read potentially sensitive information from out-of-bounds memory on the target system.Jaanus Kaap of Clarified Security reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0919.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from memory on the target system.

CVE-2018-0922.title: Microsoft Office File Object Memory Handling Error in Microsoft Word Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-0922.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in Microsoft Word and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.[Editor's note: The Preview Pane is not an attack vector.]Wayne Low of Fortinet's FortiGuard Lab reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-0922.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-0927.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Object Memory Handling Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2018-0927.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0893, CVE-2018-0876].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0933, CVE-2018-0934, CVE-2018-0936, CVE-2018-0937, CVE-2018-0872, CVE-2018-0873, CVE-2018-0874, A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and access potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0891, CVE-2018-0927, CVE-2018-0932, CVE-2018-0939, CVE-2018-0879].Ivan Fratric of Google Project Zero, Root Object, Scott Bell of Security-Assessment.com, Wei of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Johnathan Norman, Windows & Devices Group - Operating System Security Team, Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Liu Long of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, bear13oy of DBAPPSecurity Co., Ltd, and Abdulrahman Al-Qabandi reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0927.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain potentially sensitive information on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-0929.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Bypass Sandbox Restrictions, and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2018-0929.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0889, CVE-2018-0935]. This can also be exploited via an embedded ActiveX control marked 'safe for initialization' in an application or Office document that hosts the rendering engine.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the scripting engine and access potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0929].A remote user that can exploit a separate vulnerability can trigger a flaw in the handling of zone and integrity settings to escape the sandbox protections and gain elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0942].Anonymous (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), SkyLined (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), and Ivan Fratric of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0929.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0939.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Object Memory Handling Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2018-0939.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0893, CVE-2018-0876].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0933, CVE-2018-0934, CVE-2018-0936, CVE-2018-0937, CVE-2018-0872, CVE-2018-0873, CVE-2018-0874, A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and access potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0891, CVE-2018-0927, CVE-2018-0932, CVE-2018-0939, CVE-2018-0879].Ivan Fratric of Google Project Zero, Root Object, Scott Bell of Security-Assessment.com, Wei of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Johnathan Norman, Windows & Devices Group - Operating System Security Team, Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Liu Long of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, bear13oy of DBAPPSecurity Co., Ltd, and Abdulrahman Al-Qabandi reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0939.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain potentially sensitive information on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-0943.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-0943.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8128, CVE-2018-8137, CVE-2018-8139, CVE-2018-0945, CVE-2018-0946, CVE-2018-0951, CVE-2018-0953, CVE-2018-8123, CVE-2018-8178, CVE-2018-8179].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8130, CVE-2018-8133, CVE-2018-0943].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and access potentially sensitive memory contents on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8145].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and access potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-1021, CVE-2018-1025].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0954, CVE-2018-1022]. This can be exploited via and embeded ActiveX control marked as "safe for initialization" or via an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the browser rendering engine.A remote user can bypass Same-Origin Policy (SOP) restrictions to cause the target user's browser to send potentially sensitive data [CVE-2018-8112].Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Johnathan Norman, Windows & Devices Group - Operating System Security Team, Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Zhong Zhaochen of tophant.com, akayn (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), RanchoIce of Tencent ZhanluLab (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Instructor of Tencent ZhanluLab, Danny__Wei of Tencent's Xuanwu Lab (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Aradnok, Richard Zhu (fluorescence) (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), and Marcin Towalski (@mtowalski1) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0943.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-0944.title: Microsoft SharePoint Bugs Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-0944.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft SharePoint. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The system does not properly verify tenant permissions. A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted request to gain the privileges of the target tenant [CVE-2018-0947]. This can be exploited to read, edit, or delete content and change permissions.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2018-0909, CVE-2018-0910, CVE-2018-0911, CVE-2018-0912, CVE-2018-0913, CVE-2018-0914, CVE-2018-0915, CVE-2018-0916, CVE-2018-0917, CVE-2018-0921, CVE-2018-0923, CVE-2018-0944]. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Ashar Javed of Hyundai AutoEver Europe GmbH and Ivan Vagunin reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-0944.extra: A remote authenticated user can gain tenant privileges on the target system.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
