CVE-2018-8124].A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit an object memory handling flaw in the kernel and obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2018-8127, CVE-2018-8141].A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit a permissions management flaw in the Windows Kernel API and impersonate processes and cross-process communications on the target system [CVE-2018-8134].A local user with a domain user account can create a specially crafted request to trigger an object memory handling flaw and execute arbitrary code with elevated permissions on the target system [CVE-2018-8136].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling flaw in the kernel and execute arbitrary code with kernel-level privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-8897A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling flaw in the Windows kernel image and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-8170].Matt Graeber of SpecterOps, Lee Christensen (@tifkin_) of SpecterOps, nyaacate of Viettel Cyber Security (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Andrei Vlad Lutas of Bitdefender, Rohit Mothe of Project Minus Storm Team, Intel Corp., Aaron Margosis of Microsoft, Alex Bass of Microsoft, James Forshaw of Google Project Zero, Kushal Arvind Shah of Fortinet's FortiGuard Labs, Nick Peterson, Everdox Tech LLC, Andy Lutomirski, Anton Cherepanov, Senior Malware Researcher of ESET, and Ken Johnson reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8141.extra: A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can bypass security controls on the target system.

CVE-2018-8145.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-8145.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8128, CVE-2018-8137, CVE-2018-8139, CVE-2018-0945, CVE-2018-0946, CVE-2018-0951, CVE-2018-0953, CVE-2018-8123, CVE-2018-8178, CVE-2018-8179].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8130, CVE-2018-8133, CVE-2018-0943].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and access potentially sensitive memory contents on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8145].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and access potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-1021, CVE-2018-1025].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0954, CVE-2018-1022]. This can be exploited via and embeded ActiveX control marked as "safe for initialization" or via an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the browser rendering engine.A remote user can bypass Same-Origin Policy (SOP) restrictions to cause the target user's browser to send potentially sensitive data [CVE-2018-8112].Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Johnathan Norman, Windows & Devices Group - Operating System Security Team, Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Zhong Zhaochen of tophant.com, akayn (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), RanchoIce of Tencent ZhanluLab (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Instructor of Tencent ZhanluLab, Danny__Wei of Tencent's Xuanwu Lab (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Aradnok, Richard Zhu (fluorescence) (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), and Marcin Towalski (@mtowalski1) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8145.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-8149.title: Microsoft SharePoint Input Validation Flaws Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-8149.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft SharePoint. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Ashar Javed of Hyundai AutoEver Europe GmbH reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8149.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-8151.title: Microsoft Exchange Server Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Spoof Content, Inject Scripting Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-8151.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Exchange Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. A remote user can spoof content. A remote user can conduct script injection attacks.A remote user can send specially crafted email to the target server to trigger an object memory handling error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-8151].The software does not properly validate user-supplied web requests before displaying the input [CVE-2018-8152, CVE-2018-8159]. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Microsoft Exchange software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can send specially crafted email to the target server to trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-8154].A remote user can exploit a flaw in Outlook Web Access (OWA) to spoof content to conduct script or content injection attacks to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2018-8153].Nicolas Joly of Microsoft Corporation, Mohamed El Azaar, Max Smith, and Adrian Ivascu reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8151.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can spoof a server.A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Microsoft Exchange software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-8160.title: Microsoft Outlook Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2018-8160.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Outlook. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted email that, when opened by the target user, will access potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-8160].A remote user can send a specially crafted document file to bypass the Outlook attachment block filter on the target system [CVE-2018-8150].Jens Muller of Ruhr-University Bochum reported one vulnerability.
CVE-2018-8160.extra: A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-8163.title: Microsoft Office Excel File Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-8163.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8162, CVE-2018-8147, CVE-2018-8148]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will access potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8163].Omair (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative) and Jaanus Kaap of Clarified Security reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8163.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-8171.title: ASP.NET Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication Failure Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-8171.body: A vulnerability was reported in ASP.NET. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.The system does not properly validate the number of incorrect login attempts. A remote user can attempt to login without restriction.Martin Knafve reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-8171.extra: A remote user can bypass invalid login security controls to conduct brute force password guessing attacks on the target system.

CVE-2018-8176.title: Microsoft PowerPoint XML Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-8176.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft PowerPoint. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.The software does not properly validate XML content. A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.
CVE-2018-8176.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-8178.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-8178.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8128, CVE-2018-8137, CVE-2018-8139, CVE-2018-0945, CVE-2018-0946, CVE-2018-0951, CVE-2018-0953, CVE-2018-8123, CVE-2018-8178, CVE-2018-8179].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8130, CVE-2018-8133, CVE-2018-0943].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and access potentially sensitive memory contents on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8145].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and access potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-1021, CVE-2018-1025].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0954, CVE-2018-1022]. This can be exploited via and embeded ActiveX control marked as "safe for initialization" or via an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the browser rendering engine.A remote user can bypass Same-Origin Policy (SOP) restrictions to cause the target user's browser to send potentially sensitive data [CVE-2018-8112].Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Johnathan Norman, Windows & Devices Group - Operating System Security Team, Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Zhong Zhaochen of tophant.com, akayn (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), RanchoIce of Tencent ZhanluLab (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Instructor of Tencent ZhanluLab, Danny__Wei of Tencent's Xuanwu Lab (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Aradnok, Richard Zhu (fluorescence) (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), and Marcin Towalski (@mtowalski1) reported these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2018-8207.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-8207].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory initialization error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-8121].Lucas Leong (@wmliang) (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), RanchoIce of Tencent ZhanluLab, and Chen Nan of Tencent ZhanluLab reported these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2018-8209.title: Windows Wireless Network Profile Flaw Lets Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
CVE-2018-8209.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Wireless Network Profile. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A local user can run a specially crafted command to access the Wireless LAN profile of an administrative user, including passwords for wireless networks.
CVE-2018-8209.extra: A local user can access the Wireless LAN profile of an administrative user, including passwords for wireless networks.

CVE-2018-8218.title: Microsoft Hyper-V Lets Local Users on a Guest System Cause Denial of Service Conditions on the Host System
CVE-2018-8218.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Hyper-V. A local user on the guest system can cause denial of service conditions on the host system.A local privileged user on the guest system can run a specially crafted application to trigger a flaw in the Hyper-V Network Switch and cause the host system to crash.
CVE-2018-8218.extra: A local user on the guest system can cause the host system to crash.

CVE-2018-8227.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-8227.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain files on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8227, CVE-2018-8229].The system does not properly mark files. A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will access file contents on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0871].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8110, CVE-2018-8111, CVE-2018-8236].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8234].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass Same-Origin Policy (SOP) restrictions [CVE-2018-8235].Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Ziyahan Albeniz of Netsparker, Marcin Towalski (@mtowalski1), Yunhai Zhang of NSFOCUS, Zhenhuan Li(@zenhumany) of Tencent Zhanlu Lab, Jake Archibald - Google - https://jakearchibald.com, Chakra working with Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative, and Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team reported these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2018-8232.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Visual Studio. A local user can modify data on the target system.A local user can exploit a code tampering flaw in the Microsoft Macro Assembler to introduce code into an application that will modify data on the target system.David Baptiste of ESIEA - CVO Lab reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-8232.extra: A local user can modify data on the target system.

A remote user can obtain files on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8227, CVE-2018-8229].The system does not properly mark files. A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will access file contents on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0871].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8110, CVE-2018-8111, CVE-2018-8236].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8234].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass Same-Origin Policy (SOP) restrictions [CVE-2018-8235].Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Ziyahan Albeniz of Netsparker, Marcin Towalski (@mtowalski1), Yunhai Zhang of NSFOCUS, Zhenhuan Li(@zenhumany) of Tencent Zhanlu Lab, Jake Archibald - Google - https://jakearchibald.com, Chakra working with Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative, and Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8234.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain file contents on the target system.

CVE-2018-8236.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-8236.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain files on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8227, CVE-2018-8229].The system does not properly mark files. A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will access file contents on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0871].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8110, CVE-2018-8111, CVE-2018-8236].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8234].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass Same-Origin Policy (SOP) restrictions [CVE-2018-8235].Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Ziyahan Albeniz of Netsparker, Marcin Towalski (@mtowalski1), Yunhai Zhang of NSFOCUS, Zhenhuan Li(@zenhumany) of Tencent Zhanlu Lab, Jake Archibald - Google - https://jakearchibald.com, Chakra working with Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative, and Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8236.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain file contents on the target system.

CVE-2018-8239.title: Microsoft Windows GDI Component Lets Local Users View Portions of System Memory on the Target System
CVE-2018-8239.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Windows GDI. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information from system memory.A local user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will obtain potentially sensitive information from system memory on the target system.
CVE-2018-8239.extra: A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information from system memory on the target system.

CVE-2018-8242.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Bypass Security Controls
CVE-2018-8242.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can bypass UNC resource security controls on the target system and cause the target user's browser to load ostensibly restricted data [CVE-2018-0949].A remote user can create a specially crafted ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the related rendering engine that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the JavaScript engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8242, CVE-2018-8287, CVE-2018-8288, CVE-2018-8291, CVE-2018-8296]. Masato Kinugawa of Cure53, an anonymous researcher (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), an anonymous researcher (via iDefense Labs), Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, and Lokihardt of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8242.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.

CVE-2018-8244.title: Microsoft Outlook Attachment Header Parsing Bug Lets Remote Users Send Hidden Attachments to the Target User
CVE-2018-8244.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Outlook. A remote user can send hidden attachments to the target user.A remote user can send an email with specially attachment headers to send a hidden attachment to the target user. When the target user clicks on a link in the email, the hidden attachment will be opened or executed.[Editor's note: Blocked files will still be blocked on the target user's system.]Jonathan Birch of Microsoft Corporation reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-8244.extra: A remote user can send hidden attachments to the target user.

CVE-2018-8246.title: Microsoft Excel Bugs Let Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information and Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target User's System
CVE-2018-8246.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Excel. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will access potentially sensitive information from system memory on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8246]. Office 2013 SP1, 2013 RT SP1, and 2016 (except C2R) are not affected.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8248].Ying Xinlei of IceSword Lab, Qihoo 360, reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8246.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code or obtain potentially sensitive information from system memory on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-8247.title: Microsoft Office Web Apps Server Script Injection Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
CVE-2018-8247.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can conduct script injection attacks to create a link that, when loaded by the target user, will attempt to cause the target user to disclose potentially sensitive information.Ashar Javed of Hyundai AutoEver Europe GmbH reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-8247.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-8249.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Bypass Security Controls
CVE-2018-8249.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted web content or a '.url' file that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass the Mark of the Web (MOTW) tagging, causing security controls based on the MOTW tagging to be bypassed [CVE-2018-8113].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0978, CVE-2018-8249, CVE-2018-8267].Dmitri Kaslov of Telspace Systems (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Mateusz Garncarek of ING Tech Poland, Piotr Madej of ING Tech Poland, Eric Lawrence, and Scott Bell of Security-Assessment.com reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8249.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls that are based on the MOTW tagging on the target system.

CVE-2018-8251.title: Windows Media Foundation Object Memory Handling Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-8251.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Media Foundation. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in Windows Media Foundation and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.akayn (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative) and Aradnok reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8251.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-8252.title: Microsoft SharePoint Input Validation Flaws Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-8252.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft SharePoint. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Ashar Javed of Hyundai AutoEver Europe GmbH reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8252.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-8254.title: Microsoft SharePoint Input Validation Flaws Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-8254.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft SharePoint. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Ashar Javed of Hyundai AutoEver Europe GmbH reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8254.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-8260.title: Microsoft .NET Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Bypass Security and Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-8260.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft .NET. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can bypass security restrictions.A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit a flaw in the activation of COM objects and gain elevated privileges [CVE-2018-8202].A local user can present an expired certificate to bypass certificate validation on the target system [CVE-2018-8356].A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when opened by the target user via .NET, will trigger a flaw in the validation of source markup and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2018-8260].A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when opened by the target user via .NET, will trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2018-8284].Lasse Trolle Borup of Langkjaer Cyber Defence and Soroush Dalili of NCC Group reported some of these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8260.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can bypass security controls on the target system.

CVE-2018-8262.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Object Memory Handling Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Bypass Security Restrictions
CVE-2018-8262.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8262, CVE-2018-8274, CVE-2018-8275, CVE-2018-8279, CVE-2018-8301, CVE-2018-8125].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8280, CVE-2018-8286, CVE-2018-8290, CVE-2018-8294].A remote user can create a specially crafted ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the related rendering engine that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the JavaScript engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8287, CVE-2018-8288, CVE-2018-8291].A remote user can bypass the Chakra scripting engine Control Flow Guard (CFG) [CVE-2018-8276].Omair (via KrashConsulting), Akayn (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative, Aradnok, Jihui Lu of Tencent KeenLab, Simon Zuckerbraun with Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative, Kai Kang (@4B5F5F4B), Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Johnathan Norman - WDG OS Security Team, Alexandru Pitis of Microsoft Corporation, Debasish Mandal of the McAfee Labs HIPS R&D reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8262.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.

CVE-2018-8265.title: Microsoft Exchange Server Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2018-8265.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Exchange. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user and with actions performed by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-8265].A remote user can create a specially crafted Microsoft Exchange Outlook Web Access (OWA) web request to conduct script and content inject attacks to view potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8448].Sabri Haddouche of Wire Swiss GmbH and Adrian Ivascu reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8265.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-8266.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, Gain Elevated Privileges, and Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-8266.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site. A remote user can gain elevated privileges. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can bypass Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) redirect restrictions on the target system [CVE-2018-8358].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the browser and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8403].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8266, CVE-2018-8380, CVE-2018-8381, CVE-2018-8390, CVE-2018-8359].A remote user can exploit an audio request processing flaw in the WebAudio Library to view potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-8370].A remote user can create a specially crafted ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the related rendering engine that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the browser scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8372, CVE-2018-8385, CVE-2018-8355].A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site [CVE-2018-8383].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML content that, when loaded by the target user, will spoof content in the target user's browser [CVE-2018-8388].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML content that, when opened by the target user from a secure web site, will bypass cross-frame security controls and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-8351].A remote user can escape the sandbox on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8357].Bruno Keith, dannywei of Tencent Security Xuanwu Lab, exp-sky (Kai Song) of Tencent Security Xuanwu Lab, Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Qixun Zhao of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, James Lee @Windowsrcer of Kryptos Logic, Rafay Baloch, Michael Holman, Microsoft Chakra Core Team, Gareth Heyes of PortSwigger, Jihui Lu of Tencent KeenLab, Seonung Jang (@Seonunghardt) of Stealien, James Lee @Windowsrcer of Kryptos Logic, and Jun Kokatsu, Windows & Devices Group - Operating System Security Team reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8266.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary web site.A remote user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-8267.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Bypass Security Controls
CVE-2018-8267.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted web content or a '.url' file that, when loaded by the target user, will bypass the Mark of the Web (MOTW) tagging, causing security controls based on the MOTW tagging to be bypassed [CVE-2018-8113].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-0978, CVE-2018-8249, CVE-2018-8267].Dmitri Kaslov of Telspace Systems (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Mateusz Garncarek of ING Tech Poland, Piotr Madej of ING Tech Poland, Eric Lawrence, and Scott Bell of Security-Assessment.com reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8267.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls that are based on the MOTW tagging on the target system.

CVE-2018-8271.title: Windows Kernel Multiple Flaws Let Local Users Deny Service, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-8271.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can exploit an object memory handling flaw in the Windows bowser.sys kernel-mode driver to obtain potentially sensitive information from system memory [CVE-2018-8271].A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit an object memory handling error in the kernel and obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2018-8336, CVE-2018-8442, CVE-2018-8443, CVE-2018-8445, CVE-2018-8446].The kernel fails to properly initialize a memory address. A local user can run a specially crafted application to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2018-8419].A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit a flaw in the Windows Kernel API to gain elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-8410].A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit an object memory handling flaw and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-8455].Ruibo Liu of Baidu X-Lab Tianya Team, Amichai Shulman Tal Be'ery, Haikuo Xie of Baidu Security Lab (via Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative), James Forshaw of Google Project Zero, Mauro Leggieri of TRAPMINE Inc., Tanghui Chen of Baidu X-Lab Tianya Team, and Alex Ionescu, CrowdStrike Inc. reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8271.extra: A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2018-8273.title: Microsoft SQL Server Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-8273.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft SQL Server. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted query to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target SQL Server Database Engine service account.
CVE-2018-8273.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2018-8274.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8262, CVE-2018-8274, CVE-2018-8275, CVE-2018-8279, CVE-2018-8301, CVE-2018-8125].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8280, CVE-2018-8286, CVE-2018-8290, CVE-2018-8294].A remote user can create a specially crafted ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the related rendering engine that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the JavaScript engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8287, CVE-2018-8288, CVE-2018-8291].A remote user can bypass the Chakra scripting engine Control Flow Guard (CFG) [CVE-2018-8276].Omair (via KrashConsulting), Akayn (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative, Aradnok, Jihui Lu of Tencent KeenLab, Simon Zuckerbraun with Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative, Kai Kang (@4B5F5F4B), Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Johnathan Norman - WDG OS Security Team, Alexandru Pitis of Microsoft Corporation, Debasish Mandal of the McAfee Labs HIPS R&D reported these vulnerabilities.

A local user can bypass security restrictions.A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit a flaw in the activation of COM objects and gain elevated privileges [CVE-2018-8202].A local user can present an expired certificate to bypass certificate validation on the target system [CVE-2018-8356].A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when opened by the target user via .NET, will trigger a flaw in the validation of source markup and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2018-8260].A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when opened by the target user via .NET, will trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2018-8284].Lasse Trolle Borup of Langkjaer Cyber Defence and Soroush Dalili of NCC Group reported some of these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2018-8286.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Object Memory Handling Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Bypass Security Restrictions
CVE-2018-8286.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8262, CVE-2018-8274, CVE-2018-8275, CVE-2018-8279, CVE-2018-8301, CVE-2018-8125].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8280, CVE-2018-8286, CVE-2018-8290, CVE-2018-8294].A remote user can create a specially crafted ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the related rendering engine that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the JavaScript engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8287, CVE-2018-8288, CVE-2018-8291].A remote user can bypass the Chakra scripting engine Control Flow Guard (CFG) [CVE-2018-8276].Omair (via KrashConsulting), Akayn (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative, Aradnok, Jihui Lu of Tencent KeenLab, Simon Zuckerbraun with Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative, Kai Kang (@4B5F5F4B), Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Johnathan Norman - WDG OS Security Team, Alexandru Pitis of Microsoft Corporation, Debasish Mandal of the McAfee Labs HIPS R&D reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8286.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.

CVE-2018-8287.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Bypass Security Controls
CVE-2018-8287.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can bypass UNC resource security controls on the target system and cause the target user's browser to load ostensibly restricted data [CVE-2018-0949].A remote user can create a specially crafted ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the related rendering engine that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the JavaScript engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8242, CVE-2018-8287, CVE-2018-8288, CVE-2018-8291, CVE-2018-8296]. Masato Kinugawa of Cure53, an anonymous researcher (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), an anonymous researcher (via iDefense Labs), Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, and Lokihardt of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8287.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.

CVE-2018-8289.title: Microsoft Edge Lets Remote Users Spoof Content and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
CVE-2018-8289.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. A remote user can spoof content.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML content that, when loaded by the target user, will spoof content [CVE-2018-8278].A remote user can create specially crafted web content that, when loaded by the target user, trigger an object memory handling error and access potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8289, CVE-2018-8297, CVE-2018-8324, CVE-2018-8325].Jihui Lu of Tencent KeenLab, Liu Long of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Marcin Towalski (@mtowalski1), and Masato Kinugawa of Cure53 reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8289.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can spoof content.

CVE-2018-8299.title: Microsoft SharePoint Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Remote Authenticated Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-8299.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft SharePoint. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote authenticated user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2018-8299, CVE-2018-8323]. A remote authenticated user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted project or resource file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an error in validating the source markup of application packages and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8300]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Soroush Dalili of NCC Group and Adrian Ivascu reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8299.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote authenticated user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Microsoft SharePoint software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-8302.title: Microsoft Exchange E-mail Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target System
CVE-2018-8302.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Exchange. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted email to trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target Exchange server system. The code will run with System privileges.Anonymous (via Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-8302.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2018-8305.title: Windows Mail Client Embedded URL Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive IP Address Information on the Target System
CVE-2018-8305.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Mail client. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted email that, when opened by the target user, will trigger a flaw in the processing of embedded URLs and initiate a connection to a remote server, disclosing the IP address of the target user's system.Jens Muller reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-8305.extra: A remote user can obtain the target user's IP address.

CVE-2018-8311.title: Microsoft Lync Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-8311.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Lync. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an input validation flaw execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.Ping Fan (Zetta) Ke of Valkyrie-X Security Research Group (VXRL) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-8311.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-8311.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-8315.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, Gain Elevated Privileges, and Spoof Content on the Target System
CVE-2018-8315.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. A remote user can spoof servers.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8367, CVE-2018-8456, CVE-2018-8459, CVE-2018-8465, CVE-2018-8466, CVE-2018-8467].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8354].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will read privileged data across trust boundaries [CVE-2018-8315].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML content that, when loaded by the target user, will spoof a target web site [CVE-2018-8425].The Microsoft Edge Fetch API does not properly handle a filtered response type. A remote user can access potentially sensitive information from a different origin as URL parameters [CVE-2018-8366].A remote user can exploit a separate vulnerability and then escape from the AppContainer sandbox in the browser [CVE-2018-8469, CVE-2018-8463].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and access potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8452].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8457]. This can also be exploited via an embedded ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or via a Microsoft Office document that hosts the scripting rendering engine.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Microsoft Edge PDF Reader and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8464].Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Qixun Zhao of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Anonymous (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Jonathan Birch of Microsoft Corporation, Michael Holman, Microsoft Chakra Core Team, Jun Kokatsu, Windows & Devices Group - Operating System Security Team, James Lee @Windowsrcer of Kryptos Logic, Yu Zhou of Ant-financial Light-Year Security Lab, Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, and Omri Herscovici of Check Point reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8315.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can spoof content.

CVE-2018-8316.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Object Memory Handling and Validation Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-8316.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a hyperlink validation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8316]. Versions 10 and 11 are affected.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8353, CVE-2018-8371, CVE-2018-8373, CVE-2018-8389].This can also be exploited via an embedded ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or via a Microsoft Office document that hosts the scripting rendering engine.Anonymous (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Simon Zuckerbraun (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Elliot Cao of Trend Micro Security Research (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Sudhakar Verma and Ashfaq Ansari - Project Srishti (via iDefense Labs), and Ivan Fratric of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8316.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-8326.title: Microsoft Web Customizations for Active Directory Federation Services Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2018-8326.body: A vulnerability was reported in Web Customizations for Active Directory Federation Services. A remote authenticated user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.An open source customization for Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS) does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote authenticated user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Microsoft Active Directory software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2018-8326.extra: A remote authenticated user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Microsoft Active Directory software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2018-8336.title: Windows Kernel Multiple Flaws Let Local Users Deny Service, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-8336.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel. A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can exploit an object memory handling flaw in the Windows bowser.sys kernel-mode driver to obtain potentially sensitive information from system memory [CVE-2018-8271].A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit an object memory handling error in the kernel and obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2018-8336, CVE-2018-8442, CVE-2018-8443, CVE-2018-8445, CVE-2018-8446].The kernel fails to properly initialize a memory address. A local user can run a specially crafted application to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2018-8419].A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit a flaw in the Windows Kernel API to gain elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-8410].A local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit an object memory handling flaw and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-8455].Ruibo Liu of Baidu X-Lab Tianya Team, Amichai Shulman Tal Be'ery, Haikuo Xie of Baidu Security Lab (via Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative), James Forshaw of Google Project Zero, Mauro Leggieri of TRAPMINE Inc., Tanghui Chen of Baidu X-Lab Tianya Team, and Alex Ionescu, CrowdStrike Inc. reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8336.extra: A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2018-8339.title: Windows Win32k and Other Component Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2018-8339.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Win32k and other components. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger an object memory handling flaw in Win32k and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges [CVE-2018-8399, CVE-2018-8404].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a file creation flaw in Diagnostics Hub Standard Collector and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with elevated privileges [CVE-2018-0952].The Windows Installer does not properly validate user-supplied input in the Windows Installer [CVE-2018-8339].The Network Driver Interface Specification (NDIS) implementation (ndis.sys) does not properly check buffer length before copying the buffer [CVE-2018-8342, CVE-2018-8343].A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a serialization error in "Microsoft COM for Windows" and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2018-8349]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.
CVE-2018-8339.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2018-8344.title: Windows Font Library Embedded Font Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-8344.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Font Library. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create content containing specially crafted embedded fonts that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.Pengsu Cheng of Trend Micro (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative) reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2018-8344.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-8345.title: Windows '.LNK' File Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-8345.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Windows DLL (Any). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.LNK' file on a drive or remote share that, when the drive or share is opened by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Lucas Leong (@wmliang) (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8345.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-8346.title: Windows '.LNK' File Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-8346.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Windows DLL (Any). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted '.LNK' file on a drive or remote share that, when the drive or share is opened by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Lucas Leong (@wmliang) (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative) reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8346.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-8353.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer Object Memory Handling and Validation Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2018-8353.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a hyperlink validation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8316]. Versions 10 and 11 are affected.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8353, CVE-2018-8371, CVE-2018-8373, CVE-2018-8389].This can also be exploited via an embedded ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or via a Microsoft Office document that hosts the scripting rendering engine.Anonymous (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Simon Zuckerbraun (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Elliot Cao of Trend Micro Security Research (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Sudhakar Verma and Ashfaq Ansari - Project Srishti (via iDefense Labs), and Ivan Fratric of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8353.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-8354.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, Gain Elevated Privileges, and Spoof Content on the Target System
CVE-2018-8354.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. A remote user can spoof servers.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8367, CVE-2018-8456, CVE-2018-8459, CVE-2018-8465, CVE-2018-8466, CVE-2018-8467].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8354].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will read privileged data across trust boundaries [CVE-2018-8315].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML content that, when loaded by the target user, will spoof a target web site [CVE-2018-8425].The Microsoft Edge Fetch API does not properly handle a filtered response type. A remote user can access potentially sensitive information from a different origin as URL parameters [CVE-2018-8366].A remote user can exploit a separate vulnerability and then escape from the AppContainer sandbox in the browser [CVE-2018-8469, CVE-2018-8463].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and access potentially sensitive information on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8452].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8457]. This can also be exploited via an embedded ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or via a Microsoft Office document that hosts the scripting rendering engine.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Microsoft Edge PDF Reader and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8464].Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Qixun Zhao of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Anonymous (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Jonathan Birch of Microsoft Corporation, Michael Holman, Microsoft Chakra Core Team, Jun Kokatsu, Windows & Devices Group - Operating System Security Team, James Lee @Windowsrcer of Kryptos Logic, Yu Zhou of Ant-financial Light-Year Security Lab, Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, and Omri Herscovici of Check Point reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8354.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can spoof content.

CVE-2018-8355.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, Gain Elevated Privileges, and Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-8355.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site. A remote user can gain elevated privileges. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can bypass Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) redirect restrictions on the target system [CVE-2018-8358].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the browser and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8403].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8266, CVE-2018-8380, CVE-2018-8381, CVE-2018-8390, CVE-2018-8359].A remote user can exploit an audio request processing flaw in the WebAudio Library to view potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-8370].A remote user can create a specially crafted ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the related rendering engine that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the browser scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8372, CVE-2018-8385, CVE-2018-8355].A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site [CVE-2018-8383].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML content that, when loaded by the target user, will spoof content in the target user's browser [CVE-2018-8388].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML content that, when opened by the target user from a secure web site, will bypass cross-frame security controls and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-8351].A remote user can escape the sandbox on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8357].Bruno Keith, dannywei of Tencent Security Xuanwu Lab, exp-sky (Kai Song) of Tencent Security Xuanwu Lab, Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Qixun Zhao of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, James Lee @Windowsrcer of Kryptos Logic, Rafay Baloch, Michael Holman, Microsoft Chakra Core Team, Gareth Heyes of PortSwigger, Jihui Lu of Tencent KeenLab, Seonung Jang (@Seonunghardt) of Stealien, James Lee @Windowsrcer of Kryptos Logic, and Jun Kokatsu, Windows & Devices Group - Operating System Security Team reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8355.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary web site.A remote user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

CVE-2018-8360.title: Microsoft .NET Multi-Tenant High Load Stream Blending Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
CVE-2018-8360.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft .NET. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.On multi-tenant systems in a high-load/high-density environment, a remote user may be able to obtain potentially sensitive information from another stream on the target system.
CVE-2018-8360.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from another tenant on the target system.

CVE-2018-8373.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Internet Explorer. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a hyperlink validation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8316]. Versions 10 and 11 are affected.A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8353, CVE-2018-8371, CVE-2018-8373, CVE-2018-8389].This can also be exploited via an embedded ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or via a Microsoft Office document that hosts the scripting rendering engine.Anonymous (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Simon Zuckerbraun (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Elliot Cao of Trend Micro Security Research (via Trend Micro's Zero Day Initiative), Sudhakar Verma and Ashfaq Ansari - Project Srishti (via iDefense Labs), and Ivan Fratric of Google Project Zero reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8373.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2018-8380.title: Microsoft Edge Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, Gain Elevated Privileges, and Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
CVE-2018-8380.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Edge. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site. A remote user can gain elevated privileges. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.A remote user can bypass Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) redirect restrictions on the target system [CVE-2018-8358].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the browser and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8403].A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger an object memory handling error in the Chakra scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8266, CVE-2018-8380, CVE-2018-8381, CVE-2018-8390, CVE-2018-8359].A remote user can exploit an audio request processing flaw in the WebAudio Library to view potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-8370].A remote user can create a specially crafted ActiveX control marked "safe for initialization" in an application or Microsoft Office document that hosts the related rendering engine that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error in the browser scripting engine and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8372, CVE-2018-8385, CVE-2018-8355].A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site [CVE-2018-8383].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML content that, when loaded by the target user, will spoof content in the target user's browser [CVE-2018-8388].A remote user can create specially crafted HTML content that, when opened by the target user from a secure web site, will bypass cross-frame security controls and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system [CVE-2018-8351].A remote user can escape the sandbox on the target user's system [CVE-2018-8357].Bruno Keith, dannywei of Tencent Security Xuanwu Lab, exp-sky (Kai Song) of Tencent Security Xuanwu Lab, Yuki Chen of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, Lokihardt of Google Project Zero, Qixun Zhao of Qihoo 360 Vulcan Team, James Lee @Windowsrcer of Kryptos Logic, Rafay Baloch, Michael Holman, Microsoft Chakra Core Team, Gareth Heyes of PortSwigger, Jihui Lu of Tencent KeenLab, Seonung Jang (@Seonunghardt) of Stealien, James Lee @Windowsrcer of Kryptos Logic, and Jun Kokatsu, Windows & Devices Group - Operating System Security Team reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2018-8380.extra: A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary web site.A remote user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
